{ggrgl} is coming along slowly - now have enough 3d geoms to chain together into something.

{rgl} is used for 3D rendering. Interaction via the mouse.

Attached GIF = geom_segment3d() +
geom_text3d() +
annotation_height_map()

@mdsumner's {ceramic} in the mix too! 

#RStats https://t.co/hqPseJhGOV

ggplot2 tip ‚ú®

If you want to visualize the distribution of an integer variable try using geom_bar() instead of geom_histogram(). If the cardinality of your variable is now enough you might be able to see all the counts without having to pick a binwidth
